Case reference: 2014004850.CaseDesc: On November 26, 2006, Mario Julien was seen for the last time when he left his home aboard a taxi. The taxi transported him just to the roundabout in the Québec Bridge, in Quebec City, Quebec.

Case reference: 2014001578.CaseDesc: Benjamin ARSENAULT went missing from 172 Sydney St, Saint John, NB (Rooming House). He was wearing a grey suit coat.

Case reference: 2008245047.CaseDesc: Jadon may be in the company of his non-custodial mother Roxana Eliana YANEZ PARADA.

Case reference: 1989125890.CaseDesc: Jeffrey was taken by a couple driving a 1979-80 blue chevy truck.

Case reference: 2014001943.CaseDesc: Kam Lee was last seen in the Bishop Grandin and River Road area of Winnipeg, MB.  Mr. Lee's whereabouts remain unknown.

Case reference: 2018032776.CaseDesc: On Tuesday, June 12 2018, Christian Robinson was seen for the last time leaving his home in the 6th Line and Simcoe Rd. area in the Town of Bradford, Ontario.

Shirt: Grey, Golf, White and yellow pattern on the chest
Backpack: May have a backpack with unknown contents

Case reference: 2006003199.CaseDesc: On December 12, 2000, this Caucasian male, was witnessed to jump in front of a subway train at the Dundas Subway Station in Toronto. A "Playdium" card was found in his possession.

Hair: Brown, Short, baldness and reddish moustache
Teeth: Posts on upper middle incisors with crowns, fillings  in several molars
Shirt: White, Golf shirt with "Owen Sound Golf Classic '99" written on the front
Jacket: Grey, Sports jacket with "Tony Pass Oct 4/88" on the collar and "Habberlins" on the tag
Scar: Right Hand, possible burn scar on the back of the hand
Tattoo: Left Hand, unidentifiable, possibly a stick figure
Left Upper Arm, cross with dots
Right Forearm, heart with two arrows

Case reference: 2005004999.CaseDesc: On June 26, 1995, the body of an unidentified man was found in the lower part of the Niagara River. The man suffered from gynecomastia; a condition that enlarged his breasts.

Case reference: 2006005399.CaseDesc: In October 1956, Charles Ombash and his brother Tom Ombash left the Pelican Falls Residential School. They had planned to canoe back to Cat Lake, or alternately take the train to Savant Lake, get a ride to Pickle Lake, and then canoe to Cat Lake. Their family has not seen them since.

Case reference: 2014002482.CaseDesc: On January 29, 1994, Hubertus Fischer was seen for the last time as he was travelling, by car, to Seattle, Washington. On February 16, the vehicle was found abandoned on a forest service road near Seattle. During the time of his disappearance, Hubertus was residing in Edmonton, Alberta.

Case reference: 2021006608.CaseDesc: On July 4,2020, Anna Marquart was last seen by her husband and her sister as she walked away from her residence in Glenboro, Manitoba.

Case reference: 2016068945.CaseDesc: On October 27, 1965, the skeletal remains of a Caucasian male were discovered in the forest behind a farm on Lot 4, Conc. 5, Townsend Township, Waterford, Ontario. He is described as well-developed and muscular. Time since death is estimated to be approximately 2 years.

Teeth: No evidence of dental work (fillings), but he was missing four teeth.
Tie: With a silver coloured tie clip
Boots: Heavy leather boots with buckles on the outside near the top and over the instep. 11" high
Jacket: Dark coloured, zippered, two layer windbreaker with a satiny lining
Jewelry: Silver, Aluminum, Stainless Steel, Waterproof, shockproof
Glasses: Glasses with non-prescription lenses and a glasses case  with "John N. King, Toronto" on it.

Case reference: 2020036483.CaseDesc: Dorothy Cox was seen for the last time between the months of December 1942 and April 1943 in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2010001999.CaseDesc: Jeffrey Dekleyn was last seen on December 3, 1992, at 1:35 p.m. on a Hamilton RBC bank surveillance camera, making a withdrawal from an ATM machine. Family have not seen or heard from him since and described Mr. Dekleyn as being depressed.

Jacket: Brown, with the Dempsters logo on the left chest
Scar: Torso (Front), Front-to-Back scar on abdomen from surgery to remove kidney.

Case reference: 2018052183.CaseDesc: In March 2017, the partial remains of a middle-aged male were found in the Skeena River near Terrace, British Columbia. The unidentified male had moderate arthritis in his lower back and is likely to have died many years before his remains were found.

Case reference: 2019051624.CaseDesc: On September 5, 2019, Michael Samdas was last seen on Yonge Street in Toronto, Ontario. Michael has connections in several cities in Ontario, such as Hamilton, Sudbury, North Bay, Brantford, Toronto and Niagara.

Hair: Brown, Curly, Other, Dark, medium length hair with highlights on tips

Case reference: 2013000010.CaseDesc: On December 3rd 1996, family members of Jaime Wyatt made a report to the St-John's RCMP that he had not been seen since November 12th, 1996. Mr. Wyatt, a resident of Newfoundland, left the province in September 1996 to seek employment in Nova Scotia. The investigation revealed that Jaime Wyatt had been staying at the Twin Elms Motel on Inglis Street in Halifax and he was last seen there on November 16th, 1996. His motel room was paid in full until the 17th of November 1996. On the evening of November 16th, 1996, Mr. Wyatt informed the staff at the Twin Elms that someone was going to be picking him up to go out to a dinner party and other functions that evening. Mr. Wyatt was never heard from or seen since that day. Foul play is suspected.

Case reference: 2020008557.CaseDesc: On September 29, 1984, at approximately 10:00 am, Rodolf Scoulde was last seen leaving his residence in Toronto, Ontario. Rodolf was on his way to a nearby store.

Tattoo: Left Upper Arm, Sword and heart with the word "COCO"

Case reference: 2014001268.CaseDesc: On May 22, 1998, Terry Jasman wandered off from the Bow City Gravel Pit on the Bow River near Brooks, Alberta.  Terry Jasman's trailer and truck were later found abandoned.

Jeans: Denim, Light Blue, Faded blue jeans

Case reference: 2014005006.CaseDesc: On September 10, 2007, Sun Jin, her husband Joon Han, and their daughter Il Han were seen for the last time at a school in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2021019518.CaseDesc: On May 16, 2021, Bernard Grempel was reported missing from Surrey, British Columbia. On May 14, 2021, Bernard’s last known activity was when he used his Compass Card to tap onto a bus that travels back through New Westminster, North Delta and stops at the Scottsdale exchange at 120th Street and 72nd Ave in Surrey. He was last seen wearing a blue medical mask.

Tattoo: Right Forearm, Picture of Rick from Rick and Morty
Right Arm, We cannot resolve problems with the same…
Abdomen, Left rib - Other things may change but we start...
Left Upper Arm, Star of David

Case reference: 2014004377.CaseDesc: On October 3, 2003, a family member contacted Police and reported that ROSS had been missing since the evening of October 1st. She indicated ROSS and his cousin were drinking together that night and that on their way home his cousin lost sight of ROSS in the bushes. ROSS did not return home. Numerous sightings were reported to police in the days following ROSS' disappearance however no one spoke directly to ROSS. As a result these sightings are unconfirmed. Further unconfirmed sightings were reported across Canada as well and were investigated. ROSS has not been located and his whereabouts are unknown.

Case reference: 2014001111.CaseDesc: On February 7th, 1994, the remains of an adult male (25-50 years old), 5'10-6'0 tall, with a thin build, were located by land surveying students in a wooded area near the village of Anmore. The investigation determined the cause of death to be a self-inflicted gunshot wound. A black guitar case was found near the remains. He went missing sometime after May 1992.

Shirt: Cotton, Grey, Black, Long Sleeved Sweatshirt
Pants: Nylon, Blue, Maroon, Sweat pants with zipper on cuffs
Jacket: Cotton, Blue, Blue with Green Gold piping sleeved Windbreaker Jacket
Belt: Black, Blue, Fabric belt with a metal Indian Chief Belt buckle inscribed "HARA"

Case reference: 2016031589.CaseDesc: On September 20, 1978, a male was witnessed to jump in front of the subway train at Sherbourne Station in Toronto. His post-mortem length was measured at 5'11", however, this measurement may not represent his actual height due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy. His appendix is present.

Hair: Brown, Short, Dark brown hair and a few days growth of facial hair.
Watch: Silver, Aluminum, Stainless Steel, Blue, Ingraham, had a blue dial and indicated the date.
Ring: Gold, band on his left middle finger

Case reference: 2020008707.CaseDesc: On the evening of June 23, 1978, Bonny Ainslie Laframboise was seen for the last time as she went for a walk in Toronto, Ontario. Shortly after midnight, Bonnie called her husband to tell him she was lost.

Case reference: 2014001875.CaseDesc: On May 25th, 1987 at approximately 9:00 a.m., Rene Parr left his home in Trois-Rivieres, Quebec, where he was living with his sister for the previous 6 months. He was in the process of a divorce and he was scheduled to attend the courthouse the next day. Rene has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2014002363.CaseDesc: On January 7, 1997, Darcy Puddicomb was seen for the last time. He departed his residence that morning with the intention of attending work. He did not arrive.

Case reference: 2012020647.CaseDesc:
Ricky Riopel was reported missing in August 2010 by family members who had not seen or heard from him since December 2008. It was later established that Mr. Riopel had been in Moose Jaw at a health care facility in October 2009.   
Investigators now believe the last confirmed sighting of Mr. Riopel was in Saskatoon, at a downtown shopping mall, in September 2010. Mr. Riopel's parents are both failing in health which has prompted this additional request for public assistance.

Case reference: 2014006338.CaseDesc: On November 1, 1988, George Burke was last seen by his wife, when he left their residence in Edmonton, Alberta, to take the bus to work. That day, George did not arrive at work, and it is unknown whether he caught the bus.

Case reference: 2012020062.CaseDesc: On July 15, 2000 Marcus McKay went hunting with his step father and three others.  Marcus and his step father broke apart from the group to hunt on their own. Some time later, the pair successfully felled a deer. Marcus was to stay with the deer while his step father went to get help from their friends. When his stepfather returned Marcus was no where to be found. He was last seen 10 km north of Mallard and Bison Road.

Case reference: 2009000199.CaseDesc: On October 17, 1996, Alf Joergensen left his residence to go on a business trip to London, England. Mr. Joergensen told his wife he would be returning on either October 22nd or 23rd. He indicated he was meeting a business associate in London, however it was later confirmed there were no scheduled  business meetings with this particular individual, who hadn't seen Mr. Joergensen since the previous year. Mr. Joergensen flew to England on October 17, 1996 and was confirmed to have flown into Toronto airport on October 19, 1996, via British Airways. He has not been seen nor heard from since this date and his family and police are concerned for his safety and well-being.

Teeth: Visible Missing, Rear teeth both sides of upper jaw missing.  Dental records available.

Case reference: 2008018099.CaseDesc: On May 18, 1974, at approximately 8:15 hours, Douglas Henderson and Alexander Korecki were canoeing in a 14 foot fiberglass canoe close to the shore in the area of Depot Harbor, Big Sound, in Georgian Bay. The canoe capsized approximately 500 feet away from the campsite.

Case reference: 1986087920.CaseDesc: On July 30, 1985, Nicole Morin was seen for the last time leaving her apartment in Toronto, Ontario. Nicole had made arrangements to meet her friend in the lobby of their building so they could go swimming in the pool located at the rear of the building. Nicole never appeared in the lobby. Despite an intense search at the time, Nicole has not been found.

Mark: Forehead, Small birthmark on upper right side of forehead

Case reference: 2021030112.CaseDesc: On July 12, 2021, Jeanette Marcotte was reported missing in Vancouver, British Columbia. Jeanette was last seen in Saskatchewan in 1981 or 1982, where she stated that she was headed to Vancouver, British Columbia. Jeanette has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2014001361.CaseDesc: On June 13, 2000, Emmanuel Emond was reported missing in Clair, New Brunswick. Emmanuel was last seen by his family on November 28, 1996. Emmanuel is believed to have gone to Mexico at a certain point.

Scar: Cheek, Scar between nose and mouth
Tattoo: Left Hand, X on top of left hand

Case reference: 2014004925.CaseDesc: On April 20, 2007, Michael Bailey was last seen by the Thunder Bay Police on Bowlker Road in Thunder Bay, Ontario. Michael is known to travel on foot, and avoided being around people. During the time of his disappearance, he was living a transient lifestyle, and camped in wooded areas.

Shoes: White, Orange, RUNNERS, Running shoes in the colours white, orange and navy blue
Sweater: Blue, HOODIE, Hooded sweater in the colour navy blue
Jacket: Cotton, Grey, Blue, BUSH, Flannel jacket in the colours grey, blue, beige and brown

Case reference: 2011003099.CaseDesc: Brian Dunlop was dropped off in the downtown area of North Bay, Ontario by his father on the morning of June 2, 1994.  His family has not been in contact with him since that time.  In August of 1994, Brian was seen in North Bay and Oshawa, Ontario by people who knew him. This is the last time he was seen by anyone.

Case reference: 2014002866.CaseDesc: On August 29, 1989, at approximately 2:40 p.m., Jason Boulton slipped and fell into the water near 12 Mile Creek at the north east corner of the Generating Station in Port Dalhousie Harbour, Ontario.

Case reference: 2014005172.CaseDesc: Debra Marlow was last seen in Kingston Ontario on November 3rd, 2008, where she had a mental health assessment at Kingston General Hospital. She was despondent at that time, and has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2013000026.CaseDesc: John Antic's wife spoke with him at 11:00 a.m. on November 5, 2012 at a local Burlington mall. Mr. Antic left the mall wearing appropriate clothing for the weather. At approximately 7:30 p.m., Mrs. Antic received a phone call from a woman on behalf of Mr. Antic. She could hear her husband in the background saying he was eating dinner at a restaurant in Niagara Falls, Ontario. Mr. Antic's presence at the restaurant was confirmed. It is believed that he was on foot, and is familiar with public transportation. Mr. Antic has had no contact with his family or banking institutions since. There were no pre-existing medical, domestic or mental health issues.

Hair: Grey, Short, Short hair on sides and balding across top
Hat: Black, A black flat topped hat with a brim at front.  No markings.

Case reference: 2006010899.CaseDesc: Larry Zink left his home in Delavan, Wisconsin, USA. Family members have indicated that he may have been depressed.  In October 1995, Mr. Zink's vehicle was located unoccupied in a gravel pit 65 km north of Pickle Lake, Ontario.  Mr. Zink has not been seen since.

Teeth: False, Upper teeth and partial bottom teeth - front bottom teeth are his own

Case reference: 2005001999.CaseDesc: In September 1979, Norman Ritchie, was a passenger in a 16 foot cedar strip boat on Georgian Bay near Cove Island, when it capsized. Five victims were recovered, but Mr. Ritchie has never been located. He is presumed drowned.

Case reference: 2019060163.CaseDesc: On April 7, 2019, Ashley Arason was seen for the last time by her family in Winnipeg, Manitoba. Ashley had missed her son’s birthday, and this was something that was out of character

Tattoo: Right Ankle, Musical notes on a staff
Left Ankle, Chinese writing, strength, butterfly, musical note

Case reference: 2014005069.CaseDesc: On February 27, 2008, at approximately 3:00 p.m., Kien Hua was seen for the last time by his friend in Toronto, Ontario. Kien had told his friend that he was going to borrow his parents' car and was leaving town for a couple of days. On March 4, 2008, his parents' vehicle was found abandoned in Montreal, Quebec.

Case reference: 2018071052.CaseDesc: On July 11, 1998, the remains of a male individual were discovered on Sulphur Mountain in Banff National Park. There is dental work present, including multiple fillings. The post-mortem interval is estimated to be between 6 months and 5 years.

Case reference: 2020007310.CaseDesc: On December 7, 1970, at approximately 3:00pm, John Brimskill was seen for the last time by his landlord in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2014005893.CaseDesc: On September 23, 2012, Timothy Colbon was seen for the last time as he left a residence, without wearing any shoes, in Elk Lake, Ontario. Prior to his disappearance, Timothy had travelled with friends from London, Ontario to Elk Lake.

Case reference: 2014004567.CaseDesc: Marten Wenzel was last heard from by his family in August of 2004. Marten was known to contact his family at least once a month. During the time of his disappearance, Marten was living in Edmonton, Alberta.

Case reference: 2012020172.CaseDesc: Remains of this adult male were found in a wooded area in Surrey, near Scott Road and 64th Avenue.

Case reference: 2013000043.CaseDesc: On September 4, 2010, Jonathan Jette and Rachael Bagnall went hiking in a mountainous region north of Pemberton, B.C. They intended to spend 2 to 3 days climbing some peaks in the area. They failed to return and were reported missing. Their vehicle was located however despite an extensive search, no other trace of them has been found.

Sweater: Wool, Brown, White, zip up sweater (Hudson's Bay type)
Luggage: Light Green, Purple, Lavender, Mauve, 4 person tent

Case reference: 2013000127.CaseDesc: Howard Graveline dissappeared from his home on décembre 29, 2011.  His car, passport and wallet were left behind.

Case reference: 2013000124.CaseDesc: Maxwell Brown is from Bella Bella and traveled to Klemtu to look for work in late April 2012.  He was last seen in Klemtu on May 1, 2012.

Hat: Black, BASEBALL, Baseball cap with "C" on front
Tattoo: Left Side Of Neck, "REST IN PEACE"

Case reference: 2020006644.CaseDesc: On July 6, 1980, Andrew Jenkins was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario. During the time of his disappearance, Andrew may have been despondent.

Scar: Left Side Of Neck, Two inches

Case reference: 2014002728.CaseDesc: On May 25, 1996, at approximately 2:00 p.m., Gary Landry was last seen as he left his residence in Thunder Bay, Ontario, on his dark blue 12 speed Supercycle Mountain bike with black plastic fenders. Gary was prone to having seizures and frequented the north side of Thunder Bay on his bicycle.

Case reference: 2013000031.CaseDesc: On October 31, 2007, Edward D’Souza went missing from his home in Oakville, Ontario. Investigators believe that Mr. D’Souza travelled to Mumbai, India and may now be living in the Middle East under an assumed name.

Case reference: 2014002566.CaseDesc: On May 1985, Sheryl Lyn Donahue was seen for last time in Victoria, British Columbia. There were some indications she may have travelled to Vancouver, Alberta or Toronto.

Case reference: 2014002474.CaseDesc: Kenley Matheson was a student at Acadia University, Wolfville, Nova Scotia in September 1992. On September 21st it was reported that he was seen by a friend walking on Main Street in Wolfville, N.S. This was the last time anyone has seen or heard from Kenley Matheson.

Jewelry: Gold, Necklace - gold eagle pendant, 1 IN
Metal, White, Watch - White Face Seiko, 8M2571000, SN 040792
Gold, Earring worn in left ear
Coat: Nylon, Blue, Helly Hansen, mountain coat

Case reference: 2006005099.CaseDesc: Gary Millerson was last seen at his residence in Port McNicoll on the 19 April 1991.

Case reference: 2014003748.CaseDesc: On September 29th, 1996, police were contacted by a friend to report his 3 hunting partners, including Glen Mymryk who were overdue from a hunting trip. He also advised he found one of the barrels from the boat they took, floating towards shore and he could see something on the lake through the binoculars but was unsure what it was. The three men left in a loaded boat and got halfway to their destination when they decided the water conditions were too bad and they turned around. The men were bailing but the waves were too much, the motor stalled and they capsized. Mr. Mymryk was last seen floating away soon after the boat capsized. The lone survivor was rescued 7 hours after the incident and indicate the other 2 men he was with had drowned.

Case reference: 2014001545.CaseDesc: On the morning of the 6th of August 1979, Timothy Papik and his daughter Diane left Rankin Inlet, NU. heading towards Whale Cove, NU. in a canoe. They never reached their destination and they have not been seen since.

Tattoo: Left Forearm, Knife with snake, flower

Case reference: 2014005326.CaseDesc: On June 2, 1972, Edmonton Police Service members found a purse and identification belonging to Eunice Antoniuk on the walkway of the High Level Bridge in Edmonton, Alberta. A note addressed to her family was found within the purse. All police searches were negative and Eunice has not been seen since.

Case reference: 2014004511.CaseDesc: On July 29, 2004 George Davis left a residence near Creston, BC to get cigarettes. He was driving a 1981 brown Chrysler Lebaron with a British Columbia licence plate. The vehicle has not been recovered.

Mark: Eyes, Mole lower lid right eye

Case reference: 2020010632.CaseDesc: April Parisian was last seen at Yale, British Columbia, on or about March 28, 2021. April has not been seen or heard since.

Case reference: 2014003214.CaseDesc: On November 24, 1982, Clyde "Van" Ditmars was reported missing to the Thunder Bay Police Service by his family. Van sought work in British Columbia, Alberta and Manitoba in the early 1980s as a welder. Since being reported missing, Van's family has not heard from him and his whereabouts are unknown.

Scar: Abdomen, Surgical; from the center of chest to the belt line and then to the left
Abdomen, Surgical, horizontal on the left side
Neck, 1 1-2" raised scar on front of the neck

Case reference: 2012020055.CaseDesc:
The body of an Asian male was discovered by cleaning staff at the Northbrook Inn in Grand Rapids, Manitoba.  The individual had checked in at 15:30h after arriving on the bus from Winnipeg.  At 18:00h cleaning staff entered the room to find the occupant deceased in a chair.
It was learned that the subject checked into the hotel under the name "CHERON, Deoung".  A small black bag containing herbal medication was located in the room, which after translation from Korean revealed the prescription was issued to "PARK, Seng Dae"(variation of spelling PARK, Sang Dae).  It should be noted that the bus ticket-stub was located with the deceased identified "DUNG" as the individual who purchased the ticket.
Numerous checks were made with variety of agencies in an attempt to determine the man's identity.  It is believed he may be of Korean or Chinese decent.

Case reference: 2014003930.CaseDesc: On May 15, 1979, Murray Johnson was last seen boarding a train at 07:45 a.m. in Belleville, Ontario. He was presumed to be travelling West. Murray also had a noticeable curvature of his back. He has not been seen or heard from since.

Scar: Right Calf, War wound, skin is bunched up

Case reference: 2012020091.CaseDesc: On May 26, 1982, a body was found floating in the South Saskatchewan River near Rosthern, SK. The body may have been in the water for up to 9 months. All efforts to identify this person have failed. In 2004, the remains were exhumed and a further examination completed resulting in the above description of this person.

Belt: Leather, Black, Caswell, money belt; size 34

Case reference: 2006010299.CaseDesc: On November 11, 1970, at approximately 4:00 p.m., Edward Bucharest and his son, Barry Bucharest, were last seen by their family members in Kenora, Ontario. The pair had left from their cottage located on Kimberly Road, north shore of the Big Stone Bay in the municipality of Lake of the Woods, in a 14-foot fiberglass boat. The capsized boat, two life jackets, and other belongings were subsequently located.

Case reference: 2006021199.CaseDesc: Guy Labreche and Rick Dechaine were last seen at the airport in Sioux Lookout, Ontario on September 12, 1987 as they departed on a return air trip to Thunder Bay, Ontario. Mr. Labreche was the aircraft pilot and his Cessna is presumed to have crashed.

Case reference: 2021033500.CaseDesc: On August 1, 2021, at approximately 2:40 p.m., Yaoschuwach Asselin was seen for the last time at his home in the Saint-Michel neighbourhood in Montreal, Quebec. Yaoschuwach left without taking any of his personal belongings, and he has not been seen or heard from since.

Hair: Brown, Wears beard and mustache, medium length hair

Case reference: 2012020660.CaseDesc: Hamza Alsharief has not been heard from by friends or family members since December 14, 2011. Originally from Saudi Arabia, Mr. Alsharief is a student studying at the University of Saskatchewan. While foul play is not suspected at this time, family members say it is unusual that he has had no contact with them.

Hair: Brown, Short, Short to medium length
Mark: Lower Lip, Small growth of facial hair

Case reference: 2014035917.CaseDesc: On October 14, 2014, Steven Hector Gravel was reported missing from North Bay, Ontario by his mother. Family members and friends have not seen nor heard from him since December 2000.

Tattoo: Right Shoulder, Tattoo of a baby
Right Upper Arm , Stephanie, Lucky, winnie the pooh
Right Upper Arm , Heart, wings, sword

Case reference: 2006009799.CaseDesc: On May 25, 1974, Francis Foster, Robert Warren and another friend departed for a canoe trip on Basswood Lake, Quetico Park, 45 miles (72 km) south of Atikokan, Ontario. It is believed that the canoe overturned and all three are presumed drowned.

Case reference: 2016059266.CaseDesc:
On March 29th, 2008, the body of a male was found under a subway bridge at Bloor and Parliament Streets, Toronto, where he apparently slept often. A beige jacket, black nylon pants, a dark blue knit hat and tan ankle shoes with tan laces were located in close proximity to his body.  He was uncircumcised and his appendix is absent.
He is believed to be a homeless individual and was found by another homeless man who referred to him as "Pops" and "Joe".

Hair: Brown, Grey, Wavy, Short, Beard & moustache, slightly greying & yellow
Teeth: Visible Missing, Many of his teeth were lost prior to his death and the remaining teeth are decayed. There is no dental work.
Underwear: Dark Blue, White, Dark blue/black and white striped boxers
Pants: Checkered black and blue flannel pants
Deformity: Valgus deformity of both large toes
Fractured/Broken Bones: Pelvis, Healed fracture, left Ilio-pubic ramus
Scar: 1.5 cm in length, inner right knee
Right Abdomen, 16 cm scar with suture marks
a 6 cm scar on his right lower abdomen

Case reference: 2021048123.CaseDesc: On September 16, 2021, an unidentified man was discovered near 35 Carl Hall road in Toronto, Ontario.

Purse: Black, Black pouch with white edging, zippered, and on a clip
Pants: Denim, Black, Blue, Brand: Guess, jeans
Fractured/Broken Bones: Left Small Toe, 5th toe on the left foot
Left Chest, Healed fracture on the left side ribs 10,11 and 12
Right Chest, Healed fracture of right ribs 11 and 12

Case reference: 2010000198.CaseDesc: Tim Mason was known to be an avid walker, frequenting trails and off-road areas. He left his house on foot during the morning and never returned. Mr. Mason suffered from heart problems.

Hair: Black, Grey, Short, Salt and Pepper

Case reference: 2006020999.CaseDesc: Ivan Matthews was last seen when witnesses saw his sailboat out of control approximately one mile off shore near the Sand Islands in Lake Superior. It is presumed Mr. Matthews fell overboard.  He has not been seen since.

Deformity: Left Foot, club foot, sometimes uses crutches

Case reference: 2018016267.CaseDesc: Yvette Bourgon was seen for the last time in Montreal on approximately January 1, 1965. Mrs. Bourgon was hospitalized at Louis-H Lafontaine, formerly known as St-Jean-de-Dieu. Mrs. Bourgon's footprints were found in the snow near the Lachine Canal in Verdun. Her purse was found without her wallet in close proximity to the footprints.

Case reference: 2007002499.CaseDesc: Aju Chukwudiebere Iroaga, was last seen on May 15, 2006 at 4:30 p.m. by coworkers at Domtar Rd 100, sometimes called Danny Lake Rd, in Bayfield Twp, Lake Rampike. He left his place of employment, which is a local tree planting site, on foot.

Case reference: 2014001154.CaseDesc: On May 1st, 1974, the remains of an adult male were found near the East Saanich Reserve in British Columbia. He was approximately 60-75 years old, wore dentures and it is believed that he would have gone missing more than ten years before. A silver Eversharp pencil from the 1920’s engraved with the initials “MC” was found near the body.

Boots: Leather, Black, Ankle boot, size 8 or 9

Case reference: 2018053584.CaseDesc: On May 15, 1996, at approximately 1:30 p.m., Esther Adam was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario. Esther had made arrangements to meet with a friend on May 18, at 10:00 a.m., but did not attend.

Mark: Nose, Blue mark on bridge of nose

Case reference: 2014004349.CaseDesc: Candace Giebel was last seen on August 1, 2002. She may have left Vancouver with her boyfriend at that time; her whereabouts and destination are unknown. Her family has not heard from her since her disappearance.

Case reference: 2014003808.CaseDesc: On June 10, 1979, Edward McMichael was seen for the last time when he was staying at the YMCA in downtown Vancouver, British-Columbia. He previously travelled to the Yukon and Alberta and worked in the mining industry.

Case reference: 2014002751.CaseDesc: Rebecca Guno was last seen in June of 1983 by her common law husband. Miss Guno was taking a bus downtown with an unknown female friend, but did not arrive at her intended destination.

Case reference: 2019026482.CaseDesc: Kristofer Couture drove his vehicle from Alberta to the lower mainland in British Columbia to find work and had cut off ties from his family. Kristofer worked construction for a short period of time while living in his vehicle near Maple Ridge, British Columbia. Kristofer also frequented a gym in Burnaby, British Columbia. Kristofer was last seen leaving the Royal Columbian Hospital in New Westminster, British Columbia on January 26, 2019. His unoccupied vehicle was seen the following day parked at the Elk Mountain Trail in Chilliwack, British Columbia. Kristofer was reported missing on May 17, 2019 and his vehicle was found parked at the same location.

Case reference: 2008020099.CaseDesc: On July 11, 1997, James Arthur Hopcroft left the Cedar Haven Rest Home in East Gwillimbury, Ontario where he was a resident. Mr. Hopcroft has turned up on previous occasions at Queen Street Mental Health Centre. A check of the immediate surrounding area and hospitals failed to locate him. Mr. Hopcroft remains missing.

Case reference: 2014006426.CaseDesc: Sara Coates was last seen in the Stanley Park area in Calgary, Alberta. Ms. Coates was leading a nomadic lifestyle, living out of her van with her dog and 3 cats, travelling around Alberta and BC. Ms. Coates’ van was located October 22, 2013, in a secluded area of Morley, Alberta. It appeared to have been there for some time. Police investigations regarding Ms. Coates’ whereabouts are ongoing.

Scar: 2 small surgical scars on inner groin

Case reference: 2006026699.CaseDesc: On May 22, 1967, at about 10:30 a.m. Mr. Sauder was fishing with friends in Bouillon Lake, Calvin Township, District of Nipissing, in a twelve foot aluminum boat. He stood up and the boat capsized. Mr. Sauder could not swim and was not wearing a life jacket.

Case reference: 2014003894.CaseDesc: Jean Gravel and Jean-Guy Champagne were employees of the Rio Bar in downtown Trois-Rivières. On July 6, 1972, they arrived at work in the early evening; they were to work there until closing. They never returned home and have not been seen since. They were reported missing on July 10, 1972.

Jewelry: Gold, ring on the left ring finger
Silver, wedding ring on the left ring finger

Case reference: 2014005313.CaseDesc: On September 24, 2007, Azelea Brown last spoke to her mother who was overseas.

Case reference: 2009247848.CaseDesc: Christopher and Alexander are missing from the York region but were located in Poland where they are residing with their non-custodial mother.

Case reference: 2014005017.CaseDesc: On July 7, 1967, Margaret Mildred Batoche was reported missing from her family residence in Bonnyville, Alberta. Margaret always kept in contact with her family and friends, and her disappearance is considered suspicious.

Mark: Cheek, Wart on right cheek close to ear

Case reference: 2014005011.CaseDesc: On July 28, 2005, at approximately 6:15 p.m., Senekinesh Qirma was seen for the last time at the Eaton Centre in Toronto, Ontario. Senekinesh was in Canada on a visitor’s visa.

Case reference: 2014004404.CaseDesc: On September 12, 1993, Sidiki Camara was reported missing by air traffic control after disappearing from the radar while flying to Prince Edward Island from the Moncton Airport. Sidiki's plane was last recorded descending at a high rate of speed. Only a few parts of the plane were found during a search of the crash location.

Case reference: 2012020034.CaseDesc: The Edmonton Police Service is seeking assistance in locating Dylan Steven Koshman. He was last seen on October 12, 2008 on the south side of Edmonton.

Case reference: 2012020182.CaseDesc: This male was recovered from the shoreline at Pilothouse Road, West Vancouver.

Case reference: 2014005491.CaseDesc: On August 9, 2010, Michael Blakney was seen for the last time on a forest trail in the Scoudouc area of New Brunswick.

Deformity: Left Leg, Walks with a limp

Case reference: 2014003833.CaseDesc: On September 27, 1975, Barry Kelly was seen for the last time at the Speak-Easy Steakhouse in Niagara Falls, New York, in the United States. He never returned to his Niagara Falls, Ontario, home. At the time of his disappearance, Barry was despondent, and he has not been seen or heard from since.

Sweater: Orange, Brown, Hooded, Hooded with stripes
Jewelry: Metal, Silver, Aluminum, Stainless Steel, Watch
Silver, Aluminum, Stainless Steel, Chain, Around neck

Case reference: 2016044291.CaseDesc: On May 13, 1980, the body of an unidentified man was recovered from the North Saskatchewan River in Edmonton, Alberta

Teeth: False, Upper dentures were recovered; no lower teeth present; likely this individual had lower dentures.

Case reference: 2013000111.CaseDesc: On October 21, 1954, Clifford Edward Sherwood Thorne was seen for the last time at the family residence in the Verdun district of Montreal, Quebec. Clifford left home to go to school and was never seen or heard from since.
